title: "Cannot display this video mode"
body:
After I installed patch 7.1, I would get a resolution error after champ select at the loading screen. I get a black screen with yellow text telling me it "cannot display this video mode". I have had no prior issues of this sort and the only thing that's changed is the patch.

Any suggestions are appreciated.

replies.body:
This is related to a known bug with Patch 7.1 that causes this error for some players running a fullscreen resolution. I recommend pressing **ALT+ENTER** in the loading screen after champ select to toggle you into a windowed mode and bypass this issue.

Let me know if you have any questions.
This worked great! Thanks a ton mate, cheers.

Hi,I recently fixed the same issue,and it's working,this way:

1. When your monitor error pops up just at the loading screen or in-game,unplug the VGA cabel!
2. Wait 4 seconds,then plug it back.
3. Now you will get a bug splat,press don't send!
4. Press Reconnect in the client,and BOOM,it's solved AF! {{champion:74}}

The same thing happened to me too! I did try to fix mine but it doesn't work for some reason. So I might just wait till next patch and see if it can be fix then. But here's a solution that you can try to see if it works.

please open C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config\game.cfg with notepad and there you will find:

Quote:
[General]
ShowTurretRangeIndicators=1
Windowed=DEPRECATED
CfgVersion=3.15.260
SnapCameraOnRespawn=1
UserSetResolution=1
BindSysKeys=0
OSXMouseAcceleration=0
AutoAcquireTarget=1
EnableLightFx=0
WindowMode=0
PredictMovement=0
WaitForVerticalSync=1
Colors=32
Height=1024         <-----------------
Width=1280          <-----------------
GameMouseSpeed=10
SystemMouseSpeed=0


You can change the Height and Width to what that yellow text saying something like "Optimum Resolution" then it shows the resolution that would best fit your screen. 

Or you can just go on youtube and search for help there. Or search online for more help if it doesn't work. Or wait for the admin or others to respond and help you.
Yeah i tried changing those to a few different suggested  values and i get the same result every time idk thanks though

Did you try changing
>WindowMode=0

to

>WindowMode=1

?

_This is also what Alt+Enter does, except it stays so permanently._

For the future, it could also be a default _monitor_ setting that's the problem.
If you access your monitor's settings during such a black screen or indeed any other random screen issues, and scroll through the various aspect ratio options, it might be the solution.

I had a similar issue with one of my screens and an pre-widescreen era game. The game crashed on startup every time, no matter what I did with .cfg file or Windows graphics settings. 

Turned out the monitor was set to "Auto", and not forced to 16:10, like it should. Changed it to always display in 16:10, and problem solved.
_Game wanted 4:3, so the image was stretched AF (but could be tweaked around), and at least it worked, so I didn't complain._
